body: Yes to this. I'm having the same issue. I was just going to post something about it.

Same issue here. It also seems to correspond to #3098.

This is my setup using 506c47e71af6b59f53487e1b80a063ea751af946:

```
# app/models/user.rb
class User < ActiveRecord::Base
  belongs_to :company
end

# app/models/company.rb
class Company < ActiveRecord::Base
  has_many :users
  accepts_nested_attributes_for :users
end

# app/admin/company.rb
ActiveAdmin.register Company do
  form do |f|
    f.inputs do
      f.has_many :users, allow_destroy: false do |u|
        u.input :email
        u.input :name
      end
    end
  end
end
```

It results in following problems:
- There is a _Remove_ button although I set `allow_destroy` to `false`
- Only name (= last) input field is shown (as stated by @reignmaker)

Using `u.inputs :email, :name` renders both input fields (as mentioned in #3098).
Yes to using `inputs` instead of `input`. But the resulting form doesn't look right either.

Pleas try this:

``` ruby
# app/admin/company.rb
ActiveAdmin.register Company do
  form do |f|
    inputs do
      has_many :users, allow_destroy: false do
        input :email
        input :name
      end
    end
  end
end
```

But the old way should work too, I hope @varyonic will take a look on it.

EDIT: the example dosen't work too, but it should

So I would expect this to work:

```
ActiveAdmin.register Job do


  # See permitted parameters documentation:
  # https://github.com/activeadmin/activeadmin/blob/master/docs/2-resource-customization.md#setting-up-strong-parameters
  #
  permit_params :title, :description, :due_date, :created_at, :updated_at, notes_attributes: [:department, :description]
  #
  # or
  #
  # permit_params do
  #   permitted = [:permitted, :attributes]
  #   permitted << :other if resource.something?
  #   permitted
  # end
  form do |f|
    f.inputs "Job" do
      f.input :title
      f.input :description
      f.input :due_date
    end
    f.inputs "Notes" do
      f.has_many :notes, allow_destroy: true do |nf|
        nf.input :department
        nf.input :description
      end
    end
    f.actions
  end
end
```

but it leaves off the department input.

For all with this problem, 3395dd898666310882c562c7b1418f4ee74b9567 should work at least.

Please don't post more not working examples. I can reproduce this bug and try to fix it soon.
Yes, this was broken by 6afaf58357f9606835b3d3b17356a85abcb54cae  The issue is around line 40 of form_builder.rb.  I will take a look but it will take a day or two.
It always takes the last parameter only.
@dpaluy I can't reproduce that, can you provide a example and a screenshot from the result
[This](https://github.com/varyonic/activeadmin/tree/fix_has_many) fixes the example app, but still has an issue with nested has_many.  I hope to have a PR soon.

![v1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/92692/4823415/f4ebfc66-5f4e-11e4-91f5-841594428b03.png)

vs

![v2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/92692/4823419/f702db14-5f4e-11e4-84b5-5140b687ac8c.png)

My code is: 

```
f.inputs do
      f.has_many :socials, allow_destroy: true, heading: 'Social Buttons' do |sb|
        sb.input :id, as: :hidden
        sb.input :link_type, as: :select, collection: Social.link_types.keys, include_blank: false
        sb.input :review_page
      end
    end
end
```
@dpaluy sure, we know that problem, I was irritated by your comment `last parameter`, you mean `last input`

issue.title: Broken CSS for nested forms

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
I have a nested `has_one` form and the style is completely weird. Is this expected ?

![screen shot 2013-08-08 at 11 08 53](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/119303/930377/388e527a-000a-11e3-94e1-731772da16f1.png)

Here is the generating code:

``` ruby
ActiveAdmin.register Student do
  form do |f|
    f.inputs do
      f.input :offer
      f.inputs "Connexion", for: [:account, f.object.account || Account.new] do |af|
        af.input :email
        af.input :password
        af.input :password_confirmation
      end
      f.buttons
    end
  end
end
```

body: @varyonic ,  looks like there also problem with nested form (not has_many) https://github.com/activeadmin/activeadmin/issues/2400  is it related how do you think ?
@varyonic: @Fivell mean not #2400 it's self, he mean his post in: https://github.com/activeadmin/activeadmin/issues/2400#issuecomment-61110093
